title: [FR] Check and truncate string length

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: We would like help from the community to add this support

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed or may need multiple releases to complete.

body:
MLflow seems to have a length limit of 5000 when setting tags (see below).

``` bash
[...]
  File "/home/smay/miniconda3/envs/py38/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/validation.py", line 136, in _validate_length_limit
    raise MlflowException(
mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Tag value '[0.8562690322984875, 0.8544098885636596, 0.8544098885636596, 0.8544098885636596, 0.8544098885636596, 0.859181214773054, 0.86273086038245, 0.86273086038245, 0.86273086038245, 0.86273086038245, 0.86273086038245, 0.8562690322984875, 0.8544098885636596, ' had length 5276, which exceeded length limit of 5000
```
Since you do not want to increase this limit (see #2892). What about an option to cut the strings if they are longer then 5000 characters and just log a warning instead of throwing an exception?

What do you think? I am willing to contribute...
